In 2019, my team and I were able to:
• Help 1,385 Arkansans with casework
• Send 1.5 million+ outgoing letters & emails
• Secure $6 million+ in benefits for veterans
• Support $1.7 million in federal grants for Arkansas

My #1 job: serving the people of central Arkansas. pic.twitter.com/5xVdShbVV6

If there is anyone who knows how to be a fighter, it’s John Lewis. Please join me in praying for @repjohnlewis during his battle with cancer.

“For unto us a Child is born,
Unto us a Son is given;
And the government will be upon His shoulder.
And His name will be called
Wonderful, Counselor, Mighty God,
Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.”

From the Hill family to yours, I want to wish all a very Merry Christmas! pic.twitter.com/P1fx1fEXOO

As we prepare to celebrate Christmas, @BryantPolice Officer Samantha Hodgson is in stable condition after being wounded in the line of duty. Our police officers never stop protecting us, even over the holidays. Please keep Officer Hodgson in your prayers. https://bit.ly/2sgg5cY

This month, I have named the U.S. Dept. of Transportation as the latest recipient of my #GoldenFleece Award for losing nearly $3 million in taxpayer-purchased equipment and ignoring the standards to prevent this kind of loss in the first place. Read more:  https://bit.ly/2PPl8KC  pic.twitter.com/621qnfQ0tU
They were all smiles this morning at the offices of Flanagin Dental in Conway, Arkansas. It was a pleasure to deliver their packages during my @UPS ride-along. pic.twitter.com/FjR0elYDSg

Christmas is the busy season for Rock City Outfitters in Conway. This local business needs their packages delivered on-time and I was proud to make that happen today. @RockCityTees pic.twitter.com/Qid67PcpYw

The United Way of Central Arkansas is busy during the holiday season with helping make our community a better place to live. I was happy to help deliver packages to these great folks during my @UPS ride-along this morning. @UWCARK pic.twitter.com/JD0C8BVpoP
Clearly, the staff at the Faulkner County Circuit Clerk's office has got some holiday cheer. Happy to deliver some smiles during my delivery route. pic.twitter.com/j2p2oMXB8m

I'm riding with JD Davis, a 20-year veteran with UPS who served our country as a Platoon Commander in the Gulf War. Hard-working folks like JD help support our local businesses so that everyone’s holiday season can be bright. pic.twitter.com/M4kjvtqAjZ

While the holiday season may be the most wonderful time of the year for many Americans, it is the busiest for @UPS which expects to deliver 32 million packages per day in December. Once again, I teamed up with UPS for a ride along in Conway, Arkansas to help deliver packages. pic.twitter.com/aEZH63XUuK
Happy #Hanukkah to all Arkansans and Americans who celebrate the Festival of Lights today. pic.twitter.com/LVPpSXcjZG
Electricity in #LittleRock #WPS #hogs Great #holiday victory over #Valpo @RazorbackMBB pic.twitter.com/a7ZoTEoxoY
The World War I Valor Medals Review Act provides an opportunity to correct this injustice for countless American heroes and their families. https://bit.ly/393xGFC

In October 2018, while working with Dr. Brian Mitchell from @UALR, my office presented the family of Leroy Johnston, from Pine Bluff, AR, medals he earned but did not receive for his service in WWI because, like many soldiers of that era, Johnston was a victim of discrimination. pic.twitter.com/PD5FTP3DFw

When @realDonaldTrump signed the NDAA into law, it included my bill, the WWI Valor Medals Review Act. This bill rights a century-old stain of discrimination by researching military records of minority WWI vets to determine if they should have been awarded the Medal of Honor. pic.twitter.com/6PcixCxbYT

Proud to join my colleagues and U.S. Defense leadership at @realDonaldTrump’s signing of the 2020 National Defense Authorization Act. 

This bill includes:
🇺🇸A pay raise for our troops
🇺🇸Critical military upgrades
🇺🇸Sanctions against Syria, Iran, and Russia pic.twitter.com/7fLS5qRHuk – at Joint Base Andrews

The Syrian regime and their Russian partners continue to bomb innocent children in #Idlib. This is why I fought for passage of the Caesar Syria Civilian Protection Act--punishing new sanctions on Assad, Iran, and Russia for their war crimes. @syrianetf  http://bit.ly/2Z9Fxgf  pic.twitter.com/TgUOnsz9vp

Twenty-seven years ago, I worked for President George H.W. Bush to achieve his goal of making North America the world’s premier economic market. I know that he would be pleased to see this bipartisan update of NAFTA for a new generation. #USMCA pic.twitter.com/SGROK70U85

USMCA was one of President Trump's top priorities for the American people, and I want to congratulate him, U.S. Trade Representative, Ambassador Robert Lighthizer, and my House colleagues on this historic achievement.  🇺🇸 🇲🇽 🇨🇦
USMCA sets the stage for billions more in U.S. economic activity and strengthens our hand as we negotiate new trade deals with China, the United Kingdom, and other global partners.  🇺🇸 🇲🇽 🇨🇦
From day one, this renegotiation of NAFTA was focused on building growth in a 21st century economy and creating a level playing field for American workers.  🇺🇸 🇲🇽 🇨🇦

🚨🚨BREAKING: House Approves USMCA Trade Deal 🚨

I've been on the front lines of #USMCA for the past three years because it has the greatest potential to directly improve the lives of central Arkansas families.  🇺🇸 🇲🇽 🇨🇦 https://bit.ly/2sHpTg6

In the House, I cosponsored the National Suicide Hotline Designation Act which would establish 988 as the universal telephone number for the National Suicide Hotline, making it as simple as dialing 911 to call the line. @afspnational @AfspArkansas

Big news today: @FCC will designate a three-digit number to reach the National Suicide Prevention Hotline: 988. This action will save lives and combat the suicide epidemic which is the 2nd leading cause of death for Arkansans between the ages of 15-34. https://bit.ly/2Ebqedx

Today, I'm thinking of Skylar Overman and her family in Bryant, Arkansas. Skylar was diagnosed with a rare condition called Schizencephaly. The Lower Costs, More Cures Act encourages innovation of new treatments which could help the Overman family. #MoreCures pic.twitter.com/Qonvxp62FS

I participated in an important round table discussion this week focused on how faith-based organizations can help veterans battling PTSD. I was especially moved by the testimony of @realMikeLindell, CEO of @MyPillowUSA, who overcame his addictions with help from @RestoredWarrior. pic.twitter.com/LSXzcYUuqJ

Central Arkansas is home to many brave members of the active duty, reserve, & National Guard on Camp Robinson & Little Rock Air Base. The passage of #NDAA signals to Arkansas’s service members & their families that their nation stands behind them 100%. https://bit.ly/2YH5Lqh

Instead, their decision to pursue a partisan and prejudged impeachment inquiry has delayed the important work of Congress and contributed to more civic division. https://bit.ly/2YzxPf6
If House Democrats wanted to conduct oversight of President Trump’s foreign policy, they should have held oversight hearings in the House Foreign Affairs Committee.
The only bipartisan voting record that exists in the House is against the impeachment inquiry.  https://cnn.it/2LIk5JY  pic.twitter.com/2OzdaqTXdm

Additionally, the results of Pelosi’s inquiry failed to meet criteria she herself established this past March for impeachment, requiring "something so compelling and overwhelming and bipartisan."
 https://wapo.st/2rAwkBh  pic.twitter.com/17iE2sR8yh

This partisan inquiry was flawed from the start when House Democrats blatantly deviated from historical precedent by altering the process used to establish impeachment proceedings against both President Nixon in 1974 and President Clinton in 1998.

Instead, the facts did not demonstrate any offense sufficient to justify removing a duly elected U.S. president from office. No testimony produced evidence of bribery, extortion, or a high crime or misdemeanor.

Today’s announcement is another step by Speaker Pelosi and her Democrat colleagues in their race to undo the 2016 elections before Christmas. It has been clear from day one that this was an inquiry in search of a crime–and that any crime would do.  https://bit.ly/2YzxPf6
Happy birthday Senator @JohnBoozman! It is an honor to serve the people of Arkansas alongside you. pic.twitter.com/4ZVewT6hHR

Today, with the inclusion of the Caesar Syria Civilian Protection Act in the #NDAA, the United States is sending a clear message that we will not turn away and ignore heinous acts committed against civilians by Assad, Iran, and Russia.

These photos, now known as the Caesar Files, depict more than 55,000 men, women, and children who suffered horrific torture and murder in Assad’s prisons throughout Syria. 

His message to me was this: do not let the 500,000 Syrians murdered by Assad and his henchmen die in vain.

Earlier this year, I met with “Caesar,” a Syrian defector who risked his life to smuggle photographic proof of the atrocities committed by Bashar al-Assad and his brutal regime to the United States. pic.twitter.com/ZJnd3JH5Lm

The USS Hoga, the only floating vessel left that was in Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941 is docked in Little Rock as a part of the Arkansas Inland Maritime Museum, reminding us of the bravery and heroism amid the tragedy of the attacks at #PearlHarbor. https://bit.ly/2P0gzwu

Jobs! Jobs! Jobs!

✅ 50-year unemployment low. https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.cnbc.com/amp/2019/12/06/us-nonfarm-payrolls-november-2019.html …

If, after being on the Do Not Call Registry for 31 days, you continue to receive unwanted calls, you can file a complaint by calling (888) 225-5322.
You can register by telephone by calling (888) 382-1222, but note that if you register by telephone, you must call from the phone number you wish to register.
If you want to be placed on the National Do Not Call Registry, you can register your residential phone number, as well as your wireless number, for free by going to  http://www.donotcall.gov .

Are you frustrated with robocalls? So am I. That is why I cosponsored the TRACED Act (Telephone Robocall Abuse Criminal Enforcement and Deterrence Act). This bipartisan bill just passed the House 413-3. https://bit.ly/33RAPEC

We are so grateful for the sacrifice of our heroes in uniform serving abroad who will not be home with their families this holiday season.
